name: Dogs of War Online
description: Dogs Of War Online is a multiplayer tactical game, based on the classic board game "Confrontation". Build your own company of mercenaries from the wide range of units available and challenge thousands of players in intense battles.
minimum_requirements: OS: x86 or x64 bit versions of Microsoft Windows XP/Vista/Win7/Win8 Processor: AMD/Intel dual-core 1.8 GHz. AMD Athlon II and Intel Core2Duo at least Memory: 1.5GB for MS Windows XP, 2GB MS Windows Vista, 7 and 8 GB RAM Graphics: ATI/nVidia 256MB VRAM, DirectX 9.0c and Shader Model 4.0 support.  ATI/AMD Radeon 3800 series and above and NVIDIA GeForce 8600 series at least. DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 3 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9 compatible soundcard

reviews.review_text: A FREE-TO-PLAY multi-player turn-based strategy game that is NOT PAY-TO-WIN while having an actually good quality gameplay. YES.

Was a Great game possibility they just needed more content: such as unit types and a PvE co-op vs AI. Too bad they are concentrating on another game that is really going no where. In a multiplayer community single player is the least selling idea. DEVs are no longer developing the game...need I say more?

Not a bad game, could use some work on the matchmaking front as it's a little imbalanced but visaally its great, gameplays good and the customisation of your little band of merry men is fun. Reminds me a lot of Warhammer and table top games in general :)

Good Game and Concept. Not enough single player content. No community anymore. Unfortunately this game was built with multiplayer as the main focus and now, after a certain point because the community is dead, you cannot progress.
some dogs of war include chihuahuas, st bernards, claymore mines
i never had chance to finish a TRAINING GAME. everytime half way disconect.

You Downlosd... Toturial start... It's a complete mess!  Once Upun A Time: First an Introduction video... then a very simple area to accomplish= Offering that false hope that this game will be easy... Honestly I have no idea what to do... I read what was asked of me, yet Right click, Left Click... I'm a fan of Turn-Based style... yet in here it's not worth the effort... Beta .. fine... yet seriously wait before launching a waste of time... I'm not paid to respond to this obvious mess of a game!

As of yet it is not recommended or frankly speaking not a solid game to play. The mechanics (what's most of it from the previous patch that I've known, where units can level up,) changed dramatically. I don't blame the developers for their sudden change seeing as how most players take advantage of it and forcing other players to get a tie by running away.  It is a great game as it is with hardcore tactics to keep in mind if you really want to win a match; but as it is still in Beta and have no clue of the dev's goals or the game's heading whatsoever, the game can be a bit quirky.
Its a very good game Its almost like taking a card game and making it 3-D with more tactical choices.
Its a great easy strat game. Pay to win is almost completly irrelavent. Try it out! (Thats all you need to know.)

Check it out if you like pvp TBS, its not pay to win (as of feb 2014), but it is lacking in content. Currently there are only three armies to pick from, and limited maps, they plan to add more of both. Its promising but i dont see many people sticking aorund long term currently. When you have time play it for a while so you know if you are interested in it down the road when it gets more fleshed out.  Its also not very optimized, and seems to run about the same on a wide variety of machines (badly). Unfortunately due to the track record of the developers its probably going to stay that way. That said high frame rates are not required in a turn based game.

Dogs of War Online already gives me back the feeling of the good old days when playing the Confrontation Tabletop with my friends. If you are a fan of the Tabletop you will very likely enjoy this game, though right now there are only three factions available at the moment, which are: The Wolfen, The Undead and the Lions of Alahan. It is free to play and everything that I have seen can be bought with the games currency so no pay to win. I sincerely hope the game will be expanded which is likely dependent on its success. So join and experience the world of Aarklash with your Mercenary Warband!
This game has a great deal of potential for the future and is already an interesting play. I recommend it.

After some 30 hours of playing this game, I think it deserves a review. Gameplay is fast (normal fight takes around 10-15 minutes), everything is simple and battles are fun. Balance is close enough to have fun games and I've not yet encountered an opponent I stood no chance of winning.  What makes the game good, is that almost every time you lose, you can point down the exact errors you did during the game. Game certainly is not difficult, but requires some thinking to win fights: Most obivious thing is often not the best thing to do. Thinking actually goes much deeper than it looks like on first glance. Good balance between skill and luck.  A strong recommendation for anyone looking forward to lightweight turn based tactics.
Badass strategy chess-like game. The leveling and upgrades allow for diversity. Community is friendly but small. SO JOIN IT! :)

this game has been a dream of mine since i first picked up Fire emblem for the GBA when i was a kid. i played threw it and was like 'damn if there was a game like this online multiplayer...it would be the absolute SHIZZ' and you know what? i was RIGHT! this game is pretty frekaing awesome if you like turn based strategy games. screw chess i want to see people shooting slashing and killing each other on a battlefeild. its new and in the beta phase but theres so much potential ot this already amazing game that i cant wait to see what it will be like as it grows.
classical pay to win

I'm not sure if I suck or the game sux. I played about 10 matches with each starting faction. Won 1. lost MANY. It had nothing to do with strategy. It was the fact that I got parried or dodged. Then took massive damage from my opponents time and time again. I actualy laughed out loud so hard the whole house heard me and thought I was watching OJ running from the cops on youtube. And in losing so badly.. I got injuries. which to most dont seem too bad. but mine wanted me to have 9 cards to remove them? holy crap.. that's a lot of in game money for a beginner. So I deleted my company and made a new one... same thing kept happening. To the point where I'm scared to even buy a new unit. He'll just get injured and I'll have to get rid of him. So I'm stuck playing with the same starter army and no upgrades in sight. I think the game just hates me. If you're a strategy expert.. this might be for you and it might be great for you since it's such a pain. But if you're not a total copmlete badass.. you'll need real money to make it anywhere sadly. Which is why I have to give a thumbs down. I really wanted to like this game because there's not many out there like it. :(

I used to play Confrontation and this game is like a wish come true, it has a few things that need calibrating,  like stability of cameras and armies to choose from, but it brings me back to the glory days of Rackham and i am highly biased to say that i wish this game to become more popular and more features will come out of the Beta. if you like skirmish strategy this is your game!

Even at the price of £0.00, this game is a rip-off. You should be payed to play it.  Horrific optimization - I have a decent PC that can max BF3 @ 60fps and is fine on GTA V, but this game I get 15fps on LOW settings. Not to mention you have to re-start the game when you change even just one setting. My PC is far over the minimum requirements too.  Match Maker? What's that? - In my very first match I was matched against somebody who has been playing the game since it started.

Really enjoying this game atm. It reminds me of both blood bowl and Fallout - ie. using the squad's members differing abilities to overcome the enemy. What has a pretty simple layout and dynamics, has become far more tactical than I thought it would. If you enjoy small group tactics and PVP, you will dig this game. Beware, it is in beta, so there are still some glitches.  It does seem viable as free to play atm. You should be able to cover the cost of injuries with the money you make during matches. So you can go pretty hard in PVP.

Quite solid title, which is surprising as it's free to play game and 'yet another' miniature game conversion from Cyanide. You could complain about ridiculous prices, but there aren't many similiar free to play games that would boost better monetization. Aside from that, minor technical issues and beta problems(few maps, not all factions yet) it's actually really fun, deep and pretty looking. Just, for the love of gods, balance those bloody Predators...
Awesome game! Very deep and very exciting gameplay! If you like turn-based strategy, this game is for you!
Seems good but needs advanced video options
this game is gonna become really huge, i can feel it. definitely pick this up and its free to play so its not hurt on your wallet at all!
I download game make an account go on server find no one there then i find out the game is entirely based off multiplayer and there is never anyone on  11/10: would play abandoned game again
saw it in featured free-to-play games, installed it, got into game, finished the tutorial, looked up the store, uninstalled it. It's not free to play, just free to install.

I do not recommend this game, you can't clear all the levels without purchasing boosts or other soldiers. Poor movement on the troops, the troops are making the same attack all the time. There is no skills/magics so there is almost no option than clicking 'attack'.
Seems like a decent game thats SRPG. Didnt really get to play too much during the beta but its not bad thats for sure. Feels like it has a bit of side elementals from FFT by the jobs system.
Although the game is turn based. Balanced pvp with interesting strategic dynamics. Game has depth. Try it!

Its a decent game, could become a great one but needs a lot of work.   Lot of potential. Far too few units and too limited of customization. Interface could use some serious polish and more direct access to the full game rules and details of units.   The game makes me scream. WERE IS OUR WARHAMMER 40k ONLINE Tabletop port already?
♥♥♥♥ game. Pay 2 Win.
I cant loggin..way not come a EMail link :(
This is nothing more than a browser game with a nice toturial on how a strategy game could look. All units in the shop cost $ so it's not free either.
This game is complete ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥ go to hell if you bought this

bad game no balance and pay = win as certain troops own all others reguardless of stratagy. also stratagy doesnt matter its about troops you can afford.also race inbalance too..  my over all feeling playing was :: wow this is a really really bad game that i thought i would love??
Couldn't get it to work and after a few games it became very same same.
